>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Including the genders of all people involved can be helpful.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

I'm Brazilian and I wanted to worship the ancient god of my indigenous ancestors, Jurupari. The problem is that I don't know what his worship was like, but only his mythos.
The most famous one says that at the beginning of time there were two beings in the world, Tupã and Jurupari, Tupã was "a kind of saint, a moral summit, devoted to doing good, who had very few followers" and Jurupari was "the incarnation of the devil who dedicated himself to partying, dancing, drinking, music and pleasure, who was followed by many people". Tupã was jealous of Juripari and on an unlucky day he decided to burn him in a bonfire, so women followers of Jurupari came to collect his ashes, but instead they found a palm tree that they felled and used to make flutes that reproduced Jurupari's voice. Women used these magic flutes at parties where they got drunk and danced erotically with men. The Sun sent Jurupari to be reborn on Earth through a virgin and he became a lawgiver very similar to Moses among the natives who transformed their matriarchal society into a patriarchal one. So only men could use Jurupari's magic flutes.
As I like Afro-Caribbean Religions and Mesopotamian/Canaanite/Egyptian/Greco-Roman Paganism I wanted to make a syncretism of that to fill that void of worship. In Santeria, Eshu was the god of chaos who requested 1001 pigeons to Olodumare, the solar god, to let her create the Universe and then Eshu became Olodumare/Sun emissary like Jurupari. Because I clearly remember being one.
Internal dialogue was off most of the time instead of on 24/7.

NPCs who never feel that need stay NPCs and so they don't learn this skill, so they just eat up whatever someone with authority feeds them.
This "awakening" I suspect arises due to some sort of trauma (which I went through but I won't elaborate further) which can range from minor abuse to tragedies.
Or maybe a career choice demands the development of this skill, I highly doubt someone like a politician, detective or a psychiatrist would be one.

Recall that origin-of-life experiments in the 1980s by Leslie Orgel, found that RNA would often polymerize into two different forms, namely 2', 5' versus 3', 5'; and it was a mystery to chemical evolutionists why 3', 5' was favored on Earth. But then as you go up through the levels, they'll tell you, 'Oh, this stands for Gnosis, knowledge.' But then when you get higher up it stands for the Generative principle, which means, Sex."
The only deities I know of that match that description are these here:

>Phanes /ˈfeJˌniːz/ (Ancient Greek: Φάνης, genitive Φάνητος) or Protogonus /proʊˈtɒɡənəs/ (Ancient Greek: Πρωτογόνος, "first-born") was the mystic primeval deity of procreation and the generation of new life, who was introduced into Greek mythology by the Orphic tradition; other names for this Classical Greek Orphic concept included Ericapaeus /ˌɛrJkəˈpiːəs/ or Erikepaios (Ἠρικαπαῖος/Ἠρικεπαῖος "power") and Metis ("wisdom")

>Chronos (Time) is said to have created the silver egg of the universe, out of which burst the androgynous first-born deity Phanes, or Phanes-Dionysos. Phanes was a male God, in an Orphic hymn he is named as "Lord Priapos". In Greek mythology, Priapos was a minor god of fertility, protector of livestock, beehives, fruit plants, vegetable gardens and also male genitalia (Phallus)

>Phanes was a deity of light and goodness, whose name meant "to bring light" or "to shine"; a first-born god of light who emerged from a void or a watery abyss and gives birth to the universe. Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

com:
Over the past 3 years, I have effectively made my entire life revolve around sleep and meditation.
I sleep, on average, 12 hours in any given day. When I’m not sleeping, I’m meditating.
Why do I sleep so much?

Every time I sleep, I am living in a completely separate reality that I construct in my own mind.
By training my brain through thousands of hours of meditation to understand and portray the concept of consciousness into a reality that does not exist, I am able to “live” in this reality without it existing anywhere but my own mind.
To do this, I induce deep lucid states of semiconsciousness through hours of unbroken meditation where my body sleeps intermittently, but my mind is free to wander.
And wander it does.
I can be, see, or do anything that my mind could possibly fathom.

This semiconscious meditation began as a way to calm my nerves after a busy day.

It now controls my life. I have given myself the ability to conjure any reality I could possibly imagine.
I have explored the stars. I have floated through the fabric of space and time itself. I have lived through the lives of people that do not exist. I have existed as beings that do not exist.

All this to say I am unimaginably bored with my actual, physical reality. The one I’m typing this from. This life is so mundane that I cannot be bothered to anything but the absolute bare minimum to survive. I regularly only eat one meal a day and only leave my house for food and the occasional beer with a friend. Very occasional. I am living off of my Great grandmother’s estate after she passed a few years back, so I am fortunate enough to be able to afford such a sloth-like lifestyle. For now.

The money is going to run out one day and I’ll have to go back to being a regular blue collar employee until I die. I am unable to cope with this. If there is an afterlife, I hope it is my own mind.

Denizens of /x/, question for you: Can you control your own dreams? Even when they are lucid dreams?

I can't.

I have lucid dreams nearly every single night (something the motherfucker in pic related shows up in them, which always freaks me out). But one way or the other, no matter how vivid the lucid dreams are, or how conscious I am, I never can control them.

This has a lot of implications for life and philosophy. Because if i can't control my own lucid dreams, then how do I know this entire reality is not one giant lucid dream?

I hear some people say they can control them, but I can't.

There's one exception for me when I'm dreaming. If I run into a mirror in my dreams I can always go through them. They ripple like they're liquid, sort of like the mirror at the end of the 1st Evil Dead movie. Or the mirror in Mario 64 you jump through. Once I go into them I always hear some voice scream "NOOOOOOOOO" but then I become in total control of the dream. I usually have sex with hot chicks and stuff, it's fun, but I also cum in my sheets when this happens which is annoying.

But anyway, aside from that, aside from when I run through the mirror, I am not in any control of my dreams whatsoever. I've tried. I've sat and tried to do telepathy or whatever on various objects. I can't make them move. The lucid dreamworld essentially seems to follow most of the same rules of physics as the waking world for me anyhow.
